answers.answer: Yes ive been having and my doc told me its carpal tunnel
Oh man damm this ***** lolDid they suggest anything to help?
Try reducing your salt intake especially before you go to sleep at night no salty foods rather a big cup of water

I'm 37 wks tommo and have the same.. in the mornings my fingers are so stiff I can't move them for a few minutes. Haven't mentioned it to my midwife yet but was a thinking it is carpel tunnel as said above!
I barely jave any salt :( am barely even hungryBut wow even to write or turn the knop is painful..I tried soaking in warm water seems to help but def waking up is at its worst
This can be a sign of preeclampsia. How was your blood pressure?
I have the same :( and i dont have preeclampsia my dr said its part of being pregnant !! Hang in there we are almost there!!!!
but it could be preeclampsia every one is different so call them and let them know.. my hands have never gotten swollen .. good luck
Yea I've been tested for preclampsia and thank god is not it.
then maybe its perfectly normal... I was just told if I ever wake up with my hands and face swollen that I need to go in.

Yeah I've had that but only for the last week or so I'm 39 weeks now and even my ankles are swelling. I do not have preeclampsia, blood pressure is fine and I don't intake a lot of salt. I'm wondering if it's coz I'm literally at the last stage
A coworker had that as well. Carpal tunnel. She had a brace that she wore everyday.  Ask your doctor for suggestions about what to get.
Feet and ankles are normal to swell from the extra weight
Drink a lot of water, it s what helps me with my swelling

question: I'm 37wk5d and my hands are swollen but hurt to even make a fist :(This has been going on for about a week and ugh i forgot to mentioned it to the midwife.I'm just worndering if anyone else experiencing this
title: swollen hands can it be this bad? :/
